title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text:
Hello, There
This presentation will show you examples of what you can do with Quarto and Reveal.js, including:

Presenting code and LaTeX equations
Including computations in slide output
Image, video, and iframe backgrounds
Fancy transitions and animations
Printing to PDF

…and much more

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
Exploratory Data Analysis
text:
Code Animations

Over 20 syntax highlighting themes available
Default theme optimized for accessibility

# Define a server for the Shiny app
function(input, output) {
  
  # Fill in the spot we created for a plot
  output$phonePlot <- renderPlot({
    # Render a barplot
    barplot(WorldPhones[,input$region]*1000, 
            main=input$region,
            ylab="Number of Telephones",
            xlab="Year")
  })
}

Learn more: Code Animations

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text:
Line Highlighting

Highlight specific lines for emphasis
Incrementally highlight additional lines

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={'projection': 'polar'})
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()

Learn more: Line Highlighting

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text:
Executable Code

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp, mpg, color = am)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(formula = y ~ x, method = "loess")



Learn more: Executable Code

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text:
Slide Transitions
The next few slides will transition using the slide transition







Transition
Description




none
No transition (default, switch instantly)


fade
Cross fade


slide
Slide horizontally


convex
Slide at a convex angle


concave
Slide at a concave angle


zoom
Scale the incoming slide so it grows in from the center of the screen.




Learn more: Slide Transitions

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text:
Interactive Slides
Turn presentations into applications with Observable and Shiny. Use component layout to position inputs and outputs.


viewof talentWeight = Inputs.range([-2, 2], { value: 0.7, step: 0.01, label: "talent weight" })
viewof looksWeight = Inputs.range([-2, 2], { value: 0.7, step: 0.01, label: "looks weight" })
viewof minimum = Inputs.range([-2, 2], { value: 1, step: 0.01, label: "min fame" })























import { plotActors } from './actors.js';
plotActors(actors, talentWeight, looksWeight, minimum)

















Learn more: Observable, Shiny, Component Layout

title: Section 1
text:
About Spotify


626 million active users globally.
Over 100 million songs in the Spotify library.
Detailed metadata for each song, including artist, album, release date, Beats per minute, danceability, valence, energy, liveness etc
In our current project, we will explore the 2023 Spotify Dataset.
This dataset contains 953 rows and 16 columns.

title: Section 1
section: Take a look at the dataset
text:
Take a look at the dataset






Let’s explore each column one by one.{.larger}

title: Section 1
text:
Dataset







Let’s understand the column one-by-one.

title: Section 1
text:
Column Explanation

track_name: Name of the song


artist(s)_name: Name of the artist(s) of the song


artist_count: Number of artists contributing to the song


released_year: Year when the song was released


released_month: Month when the song was released


released_day: Day of the month when the song was released


streams: Total number of streams on Spotify


bpm: Beats per minute, a measure of song tempo


mode: Mode of the song (major or minor)

title: Section 1
text:
Column Explanation (cont.)

danceability_%: Percentage indicating how suitable the song is for dancing


valence_%: Positivity of the song’s musical content


energy_%: Perceived energy level of the song


acousticness_%: Amount of acoustic sound in the song


instrumentalness_%: Amount of instrumental content in the song


liveness_%: Presence of live performance elements


speechiness_%: Amount of spoken words in the song

title: Section 1
text:
Comment test

{{< utterances-comments  >}}

title: Section 1
text:
Comment one
fix comment for utteranc
Given this dataset, what are some questions that Spotify might ask to understand its users / improve its platform?







{{< utterances-comments  >}}

title: Section 1
section: Questions that Spotify might be interested in
text:
Questions that Spotify might be interested in


What are the top 5 songs in 2023?
What are the characteristics of the top 5 songs?
What are the months and days that most songs are produced?
What are the distributions of the audio features?
What are the relationship between audio features?
What are the different characteristics between the most and least-stream songs?

title: Section 1
section: IT IS HARD TO ANSWER THOSE QUESTIONS BY JUST LOOKING AT IT
text:
IT IS HARD TO ANSWER THOSE QUESTIONS BY JUST LOOKING AT IT

Therefore, we visualize the data to extract useful insights.

title: Section 1
text:
AI & Data


fix the command





flowchart LR
  Data (Round edge) --> AI (Round edge)








Furthermore, AI relies on data. Understanding the data before feeding an algorithm is important.

title: Section 1
text:
Exploratory Data Analysis

Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) is the process of analyzing data sets to summarize their main characteristics, often using visual methods.


It’s a critical step in the data analysis workflow, providing insights into the structure, patterns, and relationships within the data.

title: Section 1
text:
Exploratory Data Analysis


EDA helps you to understand the nuances in your data
EDA helps ensure the quality and reliability of your data
EDA is the foundation for complex analyses as it helps with features selection, hypothesis generation, and determining the research direction.

title: Section 1
text:
Agenda


Table Analysis
Discrete Data Analysis
Continuous Data Analysis
Trend Analysis
Relationship Analysis

title: Section 1
section: What are the top 5 songs based on stream in 2023?
text: What are the top 5 songs based on stream in 2023?

title: Section 1
section: What are the top 5 songs based on danceability in 2023?
text: What are the top 5 songs based on danceability in 2023?

title: Section 1
section: What are the bottom 5 songs based on energy in 2023?
text: What are the bottom 5 songs based on energy in 2023?

title: Section 1
text:
Discrete Feature

Features that can only take in a specific set of values, often counted in whole number. For example,



Coin flips: 0 or 1
Days of the Week: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday etc
Class Grades: Students can receive specific grades like A, B, C, D, or F.

title: Section 1
text:
Bar Plot

A bar plot is a chart that uses bars to represent the frequency or count of different categories of a discrete variable.


Bar plots are ideal for discrete variables because they clearly show the count or frequency of each category, making it easy to compare them.

title: Section 1
